    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(String term)
        Description copied from class: Terms
        Get the existing index number of a term, or add it to the term list and assign it a new index number. In index mode, this is fast. In search mode, this is slower, because we have to do a binary search through the memory-mapped terms file. However, this is only done rarely. If you care about this being fast, call buildTermIndex() at the start of your application.
        Specified by:
        indexOf in class Terms
        Parameters:
        term - the term to get the index number for
        Returns:
        the term's index number

      • indexOf

        public void indexOf(org.eclipse.collections.api.set.primitive.MutableIntSet results,
                    String term,
                    MatchSensitivity sensitivity)
        Description copied from class: Terms
        Get the index number(s) of terms matching a string. This is used in search mode when translating queries into NFAs. Depending on case-sensitivity settings, a single term string may match multiple terms.
        Specified by:
        indexOf in class Terms
        Parameters:
        results - (out) index numbers for the matching term(s)
        term - the term to get the index number for
        sensitivity - compare sensitively? (case-sensitivity currently switches both case- and diacritics-sensitivity)
